sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using matrix methods
message_1:
Find the solution to the following system of linear equations using matrix methods:

2x + 3y = 7

4x - 5y = -8
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using matrix methods, we will use the inverse matrix method. First, we write the given system in matrix form AX = B, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables, and B is the column matrix of constants.

A = | 2  3 |
    | 4 -5 |

X = | x |
    | y |

B = |  7  |
    | -8  |

Now, we need to find the inverse of matrix A. To do this, we first find the determinant of A.

det(A) = (2 * -5) - (3 * 4) = -10 - 12 = -22

Since the determinant is non-zero, the inverse of A exists. Now, we find the inverse of A, denoted as A^(-1).

A^(-1) = (1/det(A)) * adj(A), where adj(A) is the adjugate of A.

adj(A) = | -5 -3 |
         | -4  2 |

A^(-1) = (1/-22) * | -5 -3 |
                   | -4  2 |

A^(-1) = |  5/22  3/22 |
         |  4/22 -2/22 |

Now, we multiply A^(-1) by B to get the solution matrix X.

X = A^(-1) * B

X = |  5/22  3/22 | * |  7  |
    |  4/22 -2/22 |   | -8  |

X = | (5/22)*7 + (3/22)*(-8) |
    | (4/22)*7 + (-2/22)*(-8) |

X = | 35/22 - 24/22 |
    | 28/22 + 16/22 |

X = | 11/22 |
    | 44/22 |

X = | 1/2 |
    | 2   |

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is x = 1/2 and y = 2.
